title: Crypto.com says big money Formula 1, UFC deals paying off as user base expands
description:
Major advertising partnerships with Formula 1 and the UFC have helped Crypto.com reach wide audiences and drive its growth.

Crypto.com has found itself at the front and center of major fan bases in the world of Formula 1 (F1) and the UFC through lucrative sponsorship deals that have helped drive the cryptocurrency exchange’s growth.

Speaking to Cointelegraph in a wide-ranging interview on Feb. 9, Crypto.com president and chief operating officer Eric Anziani opened up about the company’s high-profile advertising campaigns with F1, UFC and its naming rights deal for the Crypto.com Arena in downtown Los Angeles:

Anziani notes that market surveys carried out by the exchange indicate that its global awareness ranks highly in terms of brand recognition from a retail cryptocurrency user perspective.

Read more

title: Sui Foundation to increase blockchain adoption through academy
description:
Sui Foundation’s Greg Siourounis shared that seven out of 10 students in an idea presentation event had blockchain as a part of their solutions.

As blockchain technology gets further mainstream adoption, students and the next generation of young entrepreneurs show that they have some knowledge of the technology.

In an interview with Cointelegraph, Greg Siourounis, managing director of the Sui Foundation, spoke about their efforts to establish a blockchain academy in collaboration with the United Arab Emirates-based school, the American University of Sharjah (AUS). 

Siourounis said that the goal of the initiative was to increase awareness within the study body about blockchain and its usability for creating applications and platforms that can solve problems. He shared that they will conduct seminars and run workshops geared toward educating youngsters about what blockchain can and cannot do.

Read more

title: Web3 Gaming Platform PlayDapp Hacked For $31M
description: Highly popular Web3 gaming platform PlayDapp has fallen victim to a major hack, leading to an estimated loss of $31 million worth of assets.
